title: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Test your knowledge of computer science fundamentals

questions.text: What is an algorithm?
options: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem
questions.correctAnswer: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a programming paradigm?
What does CPU stand for?
Which of the following is an example of secondary storage?
What is the binary representation of the decimal number 10?
Which of the following is NOT a type of computer network?
What is the time complexity of binary search?
Which of the following is NOT a high-level programming language?
What is the purpose of an operating system?
Which data structure operates on a LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?

title: Mathematics for Computer Science
description: Test your knowledge of mathematical concepts used in computer science

questions.text: What is a proposition in mathematical logic?
options: A statement that is always true
A statement that is always false
A statement that can be either true or false
A question that requires an answer
questions.correctAnswer: A statement that can be either true or false

questions.text: Which of the following is the contrapositive of 'If P, then Q'?
options: If not P, then not Q
If not Q, then not P
questions.correctAnswer: If not Q, then not P

questions.text: What is the result of the boolean expression: (true AND false) OR (NOT false)?
In set theory, what is the cardinality of the power set of a set with n elements?
Which of the following is NOT a type of graph?
What is the solution to the recurrence relation T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n with T(1) = 1?
Which of the following is an example of a bijective function?
options: f(x) = x² for all real numbers
f(x) = x³ for all real numbers
f(x) = sin(x) for all real numbers
f(x) = ex for all real numbers
questions.correctAnswer: f(x) = x³ for all real numbers

questions.text: What is the probability of getting at least one head when flipping a fair coin 3 times?
Which of the following is NOT a property of a relation that is an equivalence relation?
What is the matrix representation of a 90-degree rotation in 2D space?

title: Introduction to Programming (Python)
description: Test your knowledge of Python programming basics

questions.text: What is the correct way to create a variable named 'age' with the value 25 in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a valid data type in Python?
What will the following code output? print(3 * '7')
Which of the following is the correct way to define a function in Python?
What is the output of the following code? print(list(range(5)))
Which of the following is used to handle exceptions in Python?
What does the 'append' method do in Python lists?
options: Adds an element to the beginning of the list
Adds an element to the end of the list
Removes an element from the list
questions.correctAnswer: Adds an element to the end of the list

questions.text: What is the output of the following code? print('Hello'[1])
Which of the following is NOT a valid way to create a list in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'if __name__ == "__main__":' statement in Python?
options: It defines the main function of the program
It checks if the current module is being run directly or imported
It is a required statement in all Python programs
questions.correctAnswer: It checks if the current module is being run directly or imported

title: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
description: Test your knowledge of basic mechanical engineering concepts

questions.text: What is the primary focus of mechanical engineering?
options: Design and analysis of mechanical systems
questions.correctAnswer: Design and analysis of mechanical systems

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a branch of mechanical engineering?
What is the SI unit of force?
Which software is commonly used for computer-aided design (CAD) in mechanical engineering?
Which property measures a material's resistance to deformation?

title: Introduction to Electrical and Electronic Engineering
description: Test your knowledge of basic electrical and electronic engineering concepts

questions.text: What does Ohm's Law relate?
Which device stores electrical energy in an electric field?
What is the SI unit of electric current?
Which component is used to amplify electrical signals?
Which law states that the total voltage around a closed loop is zero?

title: Introduction to Biomedical Engineering
description: Test your knowledge of basic biomedical engineering concepts

questions.text: What is the primary focus of biomedical engineering?
Which of the following is NOT a typical area in biomedical engineering?
What does an MRI machine primarily use to create images?
Which material is commonly used for artificial joints?
Which of the following best describes tissue engineering?

title: Introduction to Biological Science
description: Test your knowledge of basic biological science concepts

questions.text: What is the basic unit of life?
Which of the following is NOT one of the four main types of biological molecules?
What is the process by which plants make their own food?
Which of the following is the genetic material in most organisms?
What is the study of how organisms interact with their environment called?

title: Introduction to Data Science
description: Test your knowledge of basic data science concepts

questions.text: What is the primary goal of data science?
options: To collect as much data as possible
To extract insights and knowledge from data
questions.correctAnswer: To extract insights and knowledge from data

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a common step in the data science process?
What is the most popular programming language for data science?
Which library is commonly used for data manipulation in Python?
What is the purpose of exploratory data analysis (EDA)?
options: To understand the data structure and patterns
questions.correctAnswer: To understand the data structure and patterns

title: Introduction to Actuarial Science
description: Test your knowledge of basic actuarial science concepts

questions.text: What is the primary focus of actuarial science?
Which industry employs the most actuaries?
What is a mortality table used for?
Which mathematical concept is fundamental to actuarial science?
What is the purpose of premium calculation in insurance?
options: To cover expected losses and expenses
questions.correctAnswer: To cover expected losses and expenses

title: Introduction to Economics
description: Test your knowledge of basic economics concepts

questions.text: What is the fundamental economic problem?
Which of the following is NOT one of the four factors of production?
What does the law of supply state?
options: As price increases, quantity supplied decreases
As price increases, quantity supplied increases
As price decreases, quantity supplied increases
Price and quantity supplied are unrelated
questions.correctAnswer: As price increases, quantity supplied increases

questions.text: What is opportunity cost?
options: The value of the next best alternative foregone
questions.correctAnswer: The value of the next best alternative foregone

questions.text: Which type of economy is characterized by government control of resources?

title: Introduction to Geography
description: Test your knowledge of basic geography concepts

questions.text: What are the two main branches of geography?
Which of the following is NOT a physical geography feature?
What is the study of maps called?
Which imaginary line divides the Earth into Northern and Southern hemispheres?
What is the primary tool used in Geographic Information Systems (GIS)?

title: Introduction to Law
description: Test your knowledge of basic legal concepts and principles

questions.text: What is the primary source of law in most countries?
Which branch of law deals with disputes between individuals?
What is the principle that ensures no one is above the law?
Which court is typically the highest court in a country?
What is the purpose of a precedent in legal systems?

title: Introduction to Political Science
description: Test your knowledge of basic political science concepts

questions.text: What is the study of politics and government called?
Which form of government is characterized by rule by the people?
What are the three branches of government in most democratic systems?
What is the purpose of separation of powers?
Which political ideology emphasizes individual freedom and limited government?

title: Thermodynamics I
description: Test your knowledge of fundamental thermodynamic principles

questions.text: What is the First Law of Thermodynamics?
options: Energy cannot be created or destroyed
Heat flows from hot to cold
Pressure and volume are inversely related
questions.correctAnswer: Energy cannot be created or destroyed

questions.text: Which thermodynamic process occurs at constant temperature?
What is the SI unit of entropy?
Which cycle is commonly used in steam power plants?
What is the efficiency of a Carnot engine?

title: Machine Design I
description: Test your knowledge of machine design principles

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a key in mechanical design?
options: To transmit torque between shaft and hub
questions.correctAnswer: To transmit torque between shaft and hub

questions.text: Which type of gear has teeth parallel to the axis?
What is the purpose of a bearing in machine design?
Which factor of safety is typically used for static loading?
What is the purpose of a clutch in mechanical systems?
options: To engage and disengage power transmission
questions.correctAnswer: To engage and disengage power transmission

title: Advanced Python Programming
description: Test your knowledge of advanced Python concepts

questions.text: What is a decorator in Python?
options: A function that modifies another function
questions.correctAnswer: A function that modifies another function

questions.text: What is the purpose of __init__ method in a class?
What does the 'yield' keyword do in Python?
What is the difference between a list and a tuple?
options: Lists are mutable, tuples are immutable
Tuples can contain more data types
questions.correctAnswer: Lists are mutable, tuples are immutable

questions.text: What is the purpose of 'self' in Python classes?
options: Reference to the instance of the class
questions.correctAnswer: Reference to the instance of the class

title: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Test your knowledge of fundamental data structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of inserting an element at the end of an array?
Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In, First Out)?
What is the time complexity of binary search?
Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
What is a hash table used for?

title: Microeconomics
description: Test your knowledge of microeconomic principles

questions.text: What is the law of diminishing marginal utility?
options: As consumption increases, marginal utility decreases
questions.correctAnswer: As consumption increases, marginal utility decreases

questions.text: What is a perfectly competitive market characterized by?
options: Many buyers and sellers, identical products
questions.correctAnswer: Many buyers and sellers, identical products

questions.text: What is the price elasticity of demand?
options: Percentage change in quantity demanded / Percentage change in price
Percentage change in price / Percentage change in quantity demanded
Change in price / Change in quantity
questions.correctAnswer: Percentage change in quantity demanded / Percentage change in price

questions.text: What is a normal good?
options: A good whose demand increases when income increases
A good whose demand decreases when income increases
A good that is always in demand
questions.correctAnswer: A good whose demand increases when income increases

questions.text: What is producer surplus?
options: Difference between what producers receive and what they would accept
Consumer willingness to pay minus price
questions.correctAnswer: Difference between what producers receive and what they would accept

title: Macroeconomics
description: Test your knowledge of macroeconomic concepts

questions.text: What does GDP stand for?
What is inflation?
What is the Phillips Curve relationship?
options: Inverse relationship between unemployment and inflation
Direct relationship between GDP and inflation
Relationship between interest rates and investment
Relationship between money supply and prices
questions.correctAnswer: Inverse relationship between unemployment and inflation

questions.text: What is fiscal policy?
What is the multiplier effect?
options: Initial spending leads to larger total increase in GDP
Inflation leads to higher interest rates
questions.correctAnswer: Initial spending leads to larger total increase in GDP

title: Constitutional Law
description: Test your knowledge of constitutional law principles

questions.text: What is judicial review?
options: Power of courts to review constitutionality of laws
questions.correctAnswer: Power of courts to review constitutionality of laws

questions.text: What is the purpose of the Bill of Rights?
What is the supremacy clause?
options: Federal law takes precedence over state law
questions.correctAnswer: Federal law takes precedence over state law

questions.text: What is due process?
What is the commerce clause?

title: International Relations
description: Test your knowledge of international relations concepts

questions.text: What is realism in international relations?
options: States act in their own self-interest
questions.correctAnswer: States act in their own self-interest

questions.text: What is the balance of power theory?
options: States form alliances to prevent dominance
questions.correctAnswer: States form alliances to prevent dominance

questions.text: What is soft power?
What is the purpose of the United Nations?
options: To maintain international peace and security
questions.correctAnswer: To maintain international peace and security

questions.text: What is globalization?

title: Advanced Statistics
description: Test your knowledge of advanced statistical concepts

questions.text: What is a p-value?
options: Probability of observing data as extreme as the sample
Probability of the null hypothesis being true
Probability of the alternative hypothesis being true
Probability of making a Type I error
questions.correctAnswer: Probability of observing data as extreme as the sample

questions.text: What is the central limit theorem?
options: Sample means approach normal distribution as n increases
Standard deviation decreases with sample size
questions.correctAnswer: Sample means approach normal distribution as n increases

questions.text: What is multiple regression?
options: Predicting dependent variable with multiple independent variables
questions.correctAnswer: Predicting dependent variable with multiple independent variables

questions.text: What is a confidence interval?
options: Range of values likely to contain the true parameter
questions.correctAnswer: Range of values likely to contain the true parameter

questions.text: What is the difference between correlation and causation?

title: Medical Imaging
description: Test your knowledge of medical imaging technologies

questions.text: What does MRI stand for?
Which imaging technique uses X-rays?
What is the principle behind ultrasound imaging?
What is contrast enhancement in medical imaging?
options: Using agents to improve image visibility
questions.correctAnswer: Using agents to improve image visibility

questions.text: What is the main advantage of PET imaging?
